body.p:
To his Excellency
Thos E. Bramlett --
Dear Gover

The bearer Mr James Jewell -- goes to see you as he tells me to ask you to remit a fine; Jewell is a sober steady man and Keeps a good and orderly house and sells good Whiskey -- is a verry clever young man and poor -- and in Consequence of his selling good Liquors -- I think he should have his sins dealt with as Kindly as possible -- If you can find it consistent with duty & your feelings I would feel grateful if you would remit so much
of his fine as you may think proper & right -- and I am sure Jewell will appreciate the kindness --

yours truly
Zeb Ward
Versailles Ky
Nov 6/65

To his Excellency
Govr. Thos, E, Bramlett
Frankfort
Ky
